articles.title: On Independence Day, Arvind Kejriwal's Counter To PM's 'Revdi' Swipe
articles.description: Delhi Chief Minister and Aam Aadmi Party convener Arvind Kejriwal today asserted that free education and healthcare are vital for India's growth, and these welfare schemes should not be called "freebies."
articles.content:

articles.title: Death threat to Mukesh Ambani: Suspect detained in Mumbai’s Dahisar
articles.description: Multiple threat calls were received on Monday at the Reliance Foundation Hospital, following which the matter was reported to the DB Marg police station, officers said.

articles.title: Rakesh Jhunjhunwala | His greatest investment hits, and odd misses
articles.description: The trader-turned-investor has left behind a legacy of taking the equity cult to the masses in his inimical style and a portfolio worth nearly Rs 32,000 crore
articles.content:

articles.title: Iran Says Salman Rushdie, Supporters To Blame For Attack
articles.description: No one has the right to level accusations against Iran over Friday's attack on Salman Rushdie, for which he and his supporters are solely to blame, the foreign ministry in Tehran said on Monday.
articles.content:
Iran has no other information about the assailant except what has appeared in media, the ministry said.
